RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 12500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING ZION was sent to the front to set a pressured pace, drew off on the turn and extended the lead while kept to task. CHERRY ORCHARD got away well, pressed the pace along the inside, fell back on the turn, angled out, bid, came up empty and was no match for the winner. JACKPOT BOY was allowed to settle and trailed the field, offered a mild bid inside and was along for show while no threat to the top two. ONE ACE pressed the pace while racing three across, swung wide leaving the second turn, stopped and was not urged through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Cherry Orchard
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed inside, fell back turn, angled out, bid,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Jackpot Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, trailed, mild bid inside, along for show

ENTRY.NAME: King Zion
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent to front, set pressured pace, drew off turn, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: One Ace
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 3across, swung wide 2nd turn, stopped, not urged stretch,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 73. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AQUACAT broke out, settled off the pace, rallied three wide on the turn, assumed command, drew off for a clear lead while under urging and held safely. LITTLE STEVEN bumped at the start, moved up to vie two across into the backstretch, fell back on the turn, continued willingly to the wire, narrowed the gap and finished second best. ELECTRIC CHARGE bumped and was squeezed at the start to be away slowly, was unhurried early and trailed the field, went widest in the drive and finished well to earn show. MINING CAMP was away alertly, set a pressured pace to the second turn, fell back, weakened in the drive and faded. MARE'S GUNNER veered out and bumped at the start, saved ground while never far back, lacked a stretch response and did not threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Mining Camp
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pressured pace to 2nd turn, fell back, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Aquacat
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, settled off pace, bid 3across turn, drew off,held safe

ENTRY.NAME: Mare's Gunner
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out start, bumped, saved ground, lacked a stretch response

ENTRY.NAME: Electric Charge
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, squeezed start, trailed, widest in drive, finished well,

ENTRY.NAME: Little Steven
ENTRY.OWNER: Northfork Farm Horses LLC McLane Chuck and Smith Brian
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, vied to 2nd turn, fell back, held for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 93. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 23000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $10,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Claimi ng races for $16,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIKE A SALTSHAKER broke out, stalked the pace while racing between horses, was steadied on the turn, shifted out at the top of the stretch, closed willingly and wore down MISTER KELLY and drew clear late under mild urging. MISTER KELLY was pushed out at the start, vied two across, inched clear on the turn and was outclosed to finish second best. LATIN CASINO vied inside to the turn, fell back, leveled off and held safely for show. LAKE MILLS was pushed out at the start, raced close to the pace three across, rallied on the turn to loom a threat, weakened and faded through the stretch. ROGER MCQUEEN saved ground while in close, fell back into the turn and had no further response.

ENTRY.NAME: Roger McQueen
ENTRY.COMMENT: in close, saved ground, fell back into turn, no further response

ENTRY.NAME: Latin Casino
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside to turn, fell back, leveled off, safe for show

ENTRY.NAME: Like a Saltshaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, stalked between horses, steadied turn, clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Mister Kelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: pushed out start, vied 2across, inched clear turn, outclosed

ENTRY.NAME: Lake Mills
ENTRY.COMMENT: pushed out start, in close 3across, rallied turn, weakened, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since June 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in estima ting allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM BORN set the pace, drew off on the turn for a clear lead, extended the margin under urging and drifted out late. WICKED SUPRISE pressed the pace to the second turn, dropped back, continued willingly and was no match for the winner. KEEN RESPONSE was never far back, bid inside on the turn, shied from the whip mid stretch, veered out and got up for show while no threat to the top two. STOLICH was never far off the pace, raced four wide along the backstretch, lacked a rally and was outfinished for third. FABRICATOR pressed the pace along the inside to the second turn and flattened out. UNCLE DICK trailed the field and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Fabricator
ENTRY.OWNER: Basler Thomas J Pohl Dennis and Watkins James M
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside to 2nd turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Born
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, drew off turn, under urging, drifted out

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Dick
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Keen Response
ENTRY.COMMENT: bid inside turn, shied from whip mid stretch, veered out, up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Stolich
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4wide backstretch, lacked a rally, outfinished for show

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Suprise
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace to 2nd turn, fell back, no match for winner,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 5F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 19000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Claiming races for $8,500 or less not considered in estimating allowances). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at Five Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KENNESAW raced mid pack, closed steadily and wore down his rival to get up at the wire. GREELEYS ICE vied three across, drew off into the turn, held a clear lead and was caught at the wire. AZRAEL vied inside, was crowded and steadied entering the turn, dropped back, continued willingly to the wire and earned show in a good effort. MEDAL OF FACT vied between horses, was crowded and steadied entering the turn, fell back and closed to narrow the gap. STAR OF KODIAK was last away, lacked early speed, went widest in the drive and lacked the needed late response. DRAGON DREW was taken back from between horses early, bid inside, altered course mid stretch and failed to menace. The rider of MEDAL OF FACT lodged an objection against the rider of GREELEYS ICE for alleged interference entering the turn. No change was made.

ENTRY.NAME: Azrael
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, crowded, steadied into turn, fell back, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Medal of Fact
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between horses, crowded, steadied into turn, fell back

ENTRY.NAME: Dragon Drew
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back from between horses early, altered course mid stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Greeleys Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3across, drew off into turn, clear lead, caught wire

ENTRY.NAME: Kennesaw
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, steady close, wore down rivals, up wire

ENTRY.NAME: Star of Kodiak
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, slow early, widest drive, lacked needed late response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 37500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $40,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Claiming races for $25,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUEENS UP set the pace, drew off leaving the turn and extended the lead under left handed urging. BERAVINA got away well, stalked the pace to the turn, fell back, continued willingly and earned place while no threat to the winner. RACEDAY ATTIRE stalked the pace while racing inside, angled out in the upper stretch, bid and came up empty. CHAMPAGNE AFFAIR dropped inside to save ground, lacked a bid and did not threaten. RONAN was outrun in an even effort. STYLE trailed the field and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Raceday Attire
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, angled out upper stretch, bid, empty late

ENTRY.NAME: Queens Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace,drew off leaving turn, extended lead, left handed urging

ENTRY.NAME: Champagne Affair
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped inside, saved ground, lacked a bid, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Ronan
ENTRY.COMMENT: even effort, failed to threaten, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Beravina
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked pace, fell back into stretch, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, showed little, outrun,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 5 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON THREE RACES IN 2022 - 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAREFOOTBOOTLEGGER raced close to the pace along the inside, fell back, came again off the rail and wore down his rivals to get up in the final strides. BORN AGAIN GEORGE pressed the pace, challenged for the lead on the turn, dueled through the stretch, was carried out in tight quarters, led late and was caught. WILDWOOD SECRET set a pressured pace, responded when challenged to duel for the lead, drifted out, yielded grudgingly and settled for show. NYOMAN stalked the pace, went seven wide at the top of the stretch, closed steadily, didn't have enough late and was outfinished in a good effort. IDEA MAN raced in the back, got through along the rail on the turn, angled out for the drive and finished well. KING TITO broke a step slowly, went widest in the drive and closed well. GOOD ONE raced mid pack in a steady effort and failed to menace. TRIPLE CHROME raced in the back, lacked a rally and did not threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Barefootbootlegger
ENTRY.OWNER: Clabar Mor Stables LLC and Haran Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: close inside, fell back, came again off rail, up in final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Wildwood Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, responded to duel, drifted out, yielded late

ENTRY.NAME: Idea Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: got through rail turn, angled out mid stretch, finished well,

ENTRY.NAME: Good One
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack, steady effort, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Born Again George
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed, challenged turn, dueled, carried out, led late, caught

ENTRY.NAME: King Tito
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke a step slowly, widest in drive, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Nyoman
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 7wide top of stretch, steady close, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Triple Chrome
ENTRY.COMMENT: in the back, lacked a rally, no threat,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 8 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Claiming races for $12,500 or less not considered in estimating allowances) .
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MEATLOAF'S CHANCE set the pace, drew off for a clear lead and just lasted. STORM'S REFLECTION was never far off the pace, closed steadily, was gaining late and just missed. BRODY'S FLY settled off the pace, bid inside leaving the turn, awaited room and came up empty when clear. LAWMAKER was unprepared at the start to be off slowly, fell far back and improved position in a steady effort. CAPTAIN CARNEGIE was through after a half and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Carnegie
ENTRY.OWNER: Birmingham, Mary and Ryan, Chris A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: through after half, stopped,

ENTRY.NAME: Lawmaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, off slowly, steady effort, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Meatloaf's Chance
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead, just lasted,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Amalio P Garcia & Anchor Down Syndicate

ENTRY.NAME: Brody's Fly
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, bid inside turn, awaited room, empty when clear

ENTRY.NAME: Storm's Reflection
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, steady close, gaining late, just missed,
